results: This is one of those movies that leaves you questioning its purpose. The romance feels forced and unrealistic. It's one of those love stories where the characters just inexplicably fall in love with each other. Throughout the film, there are numerous awkward and drawn-out moments, with the drive-in restaurant scene being particularly memorable. Charles Grodin delivers a solid performance, but the majority of the movie revolves around him and Louise Lasser. Do you really want to spend an hour and a half watching Grodin and Lasser, both with their own neurotic tendencies, together on screen?

Text: One of those, 'Why was this made?' movies. The romance is very hard to swallow. It is one of those romances, that, suddenly, 'click' - they are in love. The movie is filled with long pauses and uncomfortable moments - the drive-in restaurant being the most notable. Charles Grodin does a credible job but for most of the movie it's just him and Louise Lasser. Ask yourself, do you want to watch Grodin with his neurosis and Lasser with her neurosis together for a hour and half?
